description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders, which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed, evaluated and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders

description.narrative: UNICEF Malawi worked closely with partners to advance awareness and actions for children and young people in the country. There were 170 positive media stories including 24 international media coverage highlighting issues on children's rights and wellbeing and UNICEF's achievements in Malawi. We reached almost half of Malawi's population (9 million) with our messages on the cause of children through both traditional and online media channels. MCO organized 16 National Committee, donors and media visits, which contributed to UNICEF's objectives. We have 36,000 social media followers exceeding the annual target of 33,000. We also recruited 33, 336 U-Reporters in 2019. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/12/2019
